intro: Epilobium macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally wet habitats. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Epilobium macranthum is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species with similar floral structures.
